content.readme:
# Speiseplan-Application

Webbasierte Applikation zur Verwaltung und Bestellung von Kantinenmahlzeiten

## Installation
```bash
# Voraussetzung: Python 3.x
git clone https://github.com/ihr-repo/speiseplan.git
cd speiseplan
```

## Konfiguration
1. `meals.json`-Beispieldatei erstellen:
```json
{
  "weeks": {
    "week1": [
      {"day": "Montag", "menu": "Hühnerfrikassee", "price": 4.50},
      {"day": "Dienstag", "menu": "Vegetarische Lasagne", "price": 4.20}
    ]
  }
}
```
2. Umgebungsvariablen in `.env` setzen:
```ini
WEBHOOK_URL=https://hook.eu1.make.com/fq7mkmnr328eqvwmipkafkdy86x39jfk
PORT=8000
```

## Verwendung
```bash
# Entwicklungs-Server starten
python -m http.server %PORT%

# Im Browser öffnen
start http://localhost:%PORT%/speiseplan.html
```

## Funktionsumfang
- Mandantenauswahl (Kantine A/B)
- Wochenansicht mit Mahlzeiten
- Bulk-Input für Bestellmengen
- Webhook-Integration für Bestellungen
- Echtzeit-Vorschau der Bestellungen

## Webhook-Integration
Die Anwendung sendet Bestelldaten im JSON-Format:
```json
{
  "client": "clientA",
  "week": "week1",
  "meals": [...],
  "tenant": "Kantine A",
  "timestamp": "2025-02-06T16:03:18.000Z"
}
```

## Entwicklung
```bash
# Abhängigkeiten installieren (falls erforderlich)
npm install
```

Technologien:
- Vanilla JavaScript
- HTML5/CSS3
- Web Fetch API

## Lizenz
MIT License

analysis.description: A lightweight web app for canteens to publish weekly menus and collect bulk meal orders in real time via webhook automation. It replaces manual Excel/email workflows with a simple browser UI that feeds structured order data directly into downstream systems.

valueProposition: Digitizes weekly menu selection and meal ordering for canteens into a simple, self-service web interface.
Streams all orders as clean JSON via webhooks into ERP, catering, or billing systems to eliminate manual data entry.
Supports multiple locations/tenants with bulk order capture and real-time preview to reduce errors and food waste.

customerSegments.name: Corporate and institutional canteens (in-house or outsourced caterers)
pain_points: Inefficient manual processes (paper, email, spreadsheets) for collecting and aggregating meal orders
Frequent ordering errors and lack of real-time visibility into demand per day and location

customerSegments.name: Catering companies serving multiple B2B clients
pain_points: Complex, heterogeneous ordering channels across clients with no standard data format
High operational overhead to reconcile orders and plan production and logistics

customerSegments.name: Facility management and HR teams managing employee benefits
pain_points: Limited transparency into meal usage and costs across sites
Inability to easily integrate meal ordering data into internal reporting and subsidy workflows

revenueStreams.source: SaaS subscription for canteen ordering portal
White-label / OEM licensing to catering providers
Integration and setup fees (webhook, ERP, HR integrations)
